messages.content: What is the comfyui-previewlatent plugin used for?

The comfyui-previewlatent plugin is a ComfyUI plugin designed for previewing latents without VA(C) decoding. It is useful for showing intermediate results and can serve as a faster preview image alternative when you don't want to use VA(C) decoding.
How can comfyui-previewlatent be used as a final output for quick testing?
comfyui-previewlatent can be used as a final output for quick testing due to its functionality in previewing latents without VA(C) decoding.
What kind of previews are generated by comfyui-previewlatent?
comfyui-previewlatent decodes previews using taesd if available, otherwise it uses latent2rgb. These previews are full resolution and not limited to 512x512 like Ksampler previews.
What is the file format for the previews generated by comfyui-previewlatent?

The previews generated by comfyui-previewlatent are temporary PNG files. They contain full workflow metadata, just like 'Preview Image', so you can right-click and use 'Save Image' to save your workflow.
What resolution do the previews from comfyui-previewlatent have in comparison to Ksampler previews?
comfyui-previewlatent provides full resolution previews, whereas Ksampler previews are limited to 512x512 resolution.
